titles.title: To designate certain buildings of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.
To designate certain buildings of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention.

action.text: Mr. Boozman moved to suspend the rules and pass the bill.
Considered under suspension of the rules.
DEBATE - The House proceeded with forty minutes of debate on H.R. 4500.

vote.text: On motion to suspend the rules and pass the bill Agreed to by voice vote.

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.
Received in the Senate and Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions.

committee.name: Senate Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

term.name: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC)
Civil Rights and Liberties, Minority Issues
Department of Health and Human Services

bill.summary:
(This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)
Designates the Headquarters and Emergency Operations Center building (Building 21) and the Global Communications Center building (Building 19) of the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) located at 1600 Clifton Road in Atlanta, Georgia, as the "Rosa Parks Headquarters and Emergency Operations Center Building" and the "Mother Teresa Global Communications Center Building," respectively.
